macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: S&P 500 Closes Higher with Broad Market Participation
items.summary: The SPX gained 78 points to close at 6875 with strong market breadth, as 77% of all stocks rose and 70% of volume traded higher on 5.9 billion shares.

items.title: Jakarta Composite Index Declines 0.20% as Energy Sector Leads Losses
items.summary: The IHSG fell to 8,992.18 with six stock sectors declining, with the energy sector experiencing the steepest losses.

items.title: Great Southern Bancorp Reports Q4 Preliminary Earnings of $1.45 Per Share
items.summary: The regional bank announced preliminary fourth quarter earnings results.

items.title: Uniti Group Announces Pricing of Upsized Senior Notes Offering
items.summary: The infrastructure company completed pricing on an expanded senior notes offering.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Trump Drops EU Tariff Threats, Boosting Crypto Markets
items.summary: President Donald Trump scrapped planned tariffs on eight European countries, easing geopolitical tensions and lifting risk appetite across cryptocurrency markets. Bitcoin traded near $90K as the S&P 500, Dow Jones, and Nasdaq each gained roughly 1.2%.

items.title: Global Crypto Market Cap Reaches $3.04 Trillion with Modest Gains
items.summary: The cryptocurrency market capitalization rose to $3.04-3.12 trillion, up 0.8-0.94% over the past 24 hours. Bitcoin traded at approximately $89,900-$90,000, while major altcoins including Ethereum, Solana, and XRP posted gains of 1-3%.

items.title: Smart Money Accumulates $3.2B in Bitcoin as Retail Sells
items.summary: According to Santiment analysis, institutional investors accumulated $3.2 billion in Bitcoin while retail investors reduced positions, indicating diverging market sentiment among different investor classes.

items.title: Thailand SEC to Launch Cryptocurrency ETFs and Futures Trading
items.summary: Thailand's Securities and Exchange Commission announced plans to launch cryptocurrency exchange-traded funds and futures trading products, expanding institutional access to digital assets in the region.

items.title: Tokenization of Real-World Assets Gains Momentum at Davos 2026
items.summary: The World Economic Forum's Davos 2026 conference highlighted accelerating momentum in tokenizing real-world assets, with blockchain technology increasingly integrated into traditional finance discussions.

items.title: Bitcoin Mining Hash Rate Declines as Miners Pivot to AI
items.summary: Bitcoin mining activity trended lower with hash rate dropping 6% and difficulty down 2%, as miners increasingly shift resources toward artificial intelligence operations amid lower profitability.

items.title: Bitcoin ETP Inflows Surge to $1.66B Following 30-Day Rally
items.summary: Bitcoin exchange-traded products saw strong inflows of $1.66 billion between January 12-14, 2026, reversing prior outflows and reflecting renewed institutional interest as Bitcoin gained 12% over the past 30 days.

items.title: Grayscale Predicts Bitcoin May Hit New All-Time High in H1 2026
items.summary: Grayscale expressed optimism that Bitcoin could reach a new all-time high in the first half of 2026, citing increased institutional demand, clearer regulations, and deeper blockchain integration into traditional finance.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: RadixArk Achieves $400M Valuation in AI Inference Market Boom
items.summary: Project SGLang has spun out as RadixArk, securing $400 million valuation with backing from Accel. The UC Berkeley-originated startup focuses on optimizing AI inference engines for faster, more efficient processing in applications like autonomous vehicles and natural language processing.

items.title: Yann LeCun Joins Nexar Board as Physical AI Scales Beyond Labs
items.summary: AI pioneer Yann LeCun has been appointed to Nexar's board as the company advances physical AI systems that learn from real-world environments. Nexar's BADAS platform uses distributed vision networks from connected vehicles to train AI systems on actual driving conditions rather than simulations.

items.title: Clarivate Launches Nexus Academic AI Assistant
items.summary: Clarivate introduced Nexus, an academic assistant that integrates trusted library content and services directly into AI tools used by students and researchers. The platform initially launches as a browser extension and will later support integration into campus learning management systems.

items.title: AI and No-Code Tools Reshape Software Development in 2026
items.summary: Industry analysis predicts that fast MVP development is no longer a competitive advantage as AI democratizes building speed. Investors now expect founders to validate ideas before raising capital, shifting focus from construction speed to evidence of market demand.

items.title: Tech Leaders Debate AI Job Impact at Davos
items.summary: Executives including Jensen Huang and Satya Nadella discussed AI's workforce implications at the World Economic Forum. Forrester research estimates AI could displace 6 percent of US jobs by 2030, approximately 10.4 million roles, through automation and robotic process automation.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Ubisoft Announces Major Restructuring, Cancels Six Games Including Prince of Persia Remake
items.summary: Ubisoft revealed a sweeping operational overhaul on January 21, 2026, canceling six games—including the Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time remake—and delaying seven others while restructuring around five Creative Houses. The announcement led to a 30% drop in Ubisoft's stock, marking its worst day ever.

items.title: Ubisoft Stock Plunges 30% After Game Cancellations and Profit Warning
items.summary: The cancellation of six games, including Prince of Persia remake, triggered Ubisoft's shares to fall 30% on January 22, 2026—the company's worst trading day since 1996—amid a EUR1 billion adjusted loss forecast and cost cuts.

items.title: Ubisoft Invests in Generative AI and Splits Development Across Five Creative Houses
items.summary: As part of its 2026 restructuring, Ubisoft is making targeted investments in generative AI and reorganizing game development into five specialized Creative Houses.

items.title: Netflix Games Advances Cloud-First Strategy for TV Gaming in 2026
items.summary: Netflix co-CEO Greg Peters highlighted cloud-based TV games as a major priority and advancement during the 2025 earnings call, pushing the cloud-first strategy forward in 2026.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: TSMC Reports Strong Results, AI Demand Remains 'Endless' as Chip Supply Stays Tight
items.summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company posted strong quarterly results and reinforced sustained demand for chips, signaling continued tight supply across the global compute market. TSMC's outlook is a key indicator for data center buildouts and GPU availability.

items.title: Elon Musk Predicts 'Agonizingly Slow' Cybercab and Optimus Robot Rollout
items.summary: Tesla CEO Elon Musk cautioned that initial production of the Cybercab and Optimus robots will follow an S-curve pattern, starting very slowly before ramping up. Cybercab production is set to begin in fewer than 100 days, with low Optimus production expected by 2025 and high production in 2026.

items.title: Intel to Report Quarterly Results as Chip Maker Shares Surge
items.summary: Intel will report earnings after market close as shares of the chip maker have been soaring. The company is among the top-searched tickers on MarketWatch.

items.title: Alibaba Reportedly Seeking IPO for Chipmaking Unit T-Head
items.summary: Chinese tech giant Alibaba stock is rising after reports that the company could be pursuing an initial public offering for its chipmaking subsidiary T-Head.
